title: Retro Football Heroes
description: Huddle up and remember the gridiron greats who made football America's favorite sport from the 1940s through the 1980s!

questions.question: Which quarterback led the Green Bay Packers to victory in the first two Super Bowls in 1967 and 1968?
Joe Namath famously guaranteed victory before which Super Bowl, then led the Jets to an upset win?
Which running back, known as 'The Juice,' rushed for over 2,000 yards in a 14-game season in 1973?
The 'Immaculate Reception' in 1972 was caught by which Pittsburgh Steelers player?
Which legendary coach led the Green Bay Packers to five NFL championships in seven years during the 1960s?
Jim Brown, considered one of the greatest running backs ever, played his entire career for which team?
Which team completed the only perfect season in NFL history in 1972, going 17-0?
Walter Payton, nicknamed 'Sweetness,' played his entire career for which NFL team?
Which quarterback led the Pittsburgh Steelers to four Super Bowl victories in six years during the 1970s?
The 'Steel Curtain' was the famous defensive unit of which NFL team in the 1970s?
Which receiver made a spectacular diving catch in Super Bowl XIII and was known as one of the most graceful players in football?
Johnny Unitas set a record by throwing touchdown passes in how many consecutive games from 1956 to 1960?
Which team was known as 'America's Team' starting in the 1970s?
Joe Montana led the San Francisco 49ers to their first Super Bowl victory in January 1982. What was his famous nickname?
The 1958 NFL Championship Game between the Baltimore Colts and New York Giants is often called what?
